subject: Re: BIN IMAGES - AUSSIE SKIPS UPDATE

full_threads.body: Hey @joy - produced a document for details that may help on this request by Nansi - https://docs.google.com/document/d/1GYLYangvOhGu-GEp7L3Q0d4_8M60QWwiHZ62q3UKc-U/edit?tab=t.0. Passing this to you now. Thank you so much 🙏

action.text: Allie Borcena moved this conversation from the Wolf IQ inbox

full_threads.body:
Hi Nansi,

Thanks for your honest feedback, and our sincere apologies for the confusion here.

We completely understand how important it is that the bin graphics match your actual product, especially when compared to the reference examples you’ve shared. We’ll have our team take another close look and revise the visuals to make sure they’re as close to identical as possible to your real hook lift bins - rectangle style and all.

We’ll circle back as soon as the updated graphics are ready.

Thanks again for your patience, and we really appreciate you bringing this to our attention.

I'd like to be completely honest and say that the hook bins are still different from what I have previously sent with the examples from the competitors.

If you are using AI to get these bins designed and they are not identical to the real bin style then I do not want to proceed. Our Hook lift bins are rectangle - the ones you have staged below are not the same



Nansi Philips
​​​​

Administration System\Operations Manager

t: 1300 11 00 11
|
m: 0404 029 100

e: nansi.philips@aussieindustries.com.au

w: www.aussieindustries.com.au

a:

14 Bellfrog St
,
Greenarce
,
2190

PO BOX 156, Belfield NSW 2191







IMPORTANT: The contents of this email and any attachments are confidential.
​They are intended for the named recipient(s) only. If you have received this email by mistake,
​please notify the sender immediately and do not disclose the contents to anyone or make copies thereof.

Hi Nansi,

Hope you’re doing well!

Just following up on our last note regarding the updated images — we shared a preview a little while ago and were just waiting on your confirmation to move ahead.

Whenever you have a moment, could you please take a quick look and let us know if everything looks good on your end? Once we hear from you, we’ll go ahead and implement it on the live site.

No rush at all — just wanted to make sure this didn’t slip through the cracks.

Hi Nansi,

Apologies for the delay, and thanks again for your patience.

Just confirming that we’ve updated the images on our end—here’s how it’s looking now:

Could you please take a look a look at your end and let us know if everything looks good on your side?

Once we get your confirmation, we'll go ahead and implement it on the live site.

Thanks so much!

Hey @andy ,

Apologies for the back and forth and appreciate the feedback and we'll take note of this for future and current tickets. We’ve made some updates to the images and tweaked the CSS a bit based on Nansi's feedback.

@joel s on the same page that a centered layout would be easier to manage, but unfortunately we’re not able to modify the design or layout since it originally came through from Nansi and her team a few months back.

@adriane + @joel - this one is starting to damage customer confidence a bit. My thoughts here, we may need to change the overall design to make this work?

https://www.loom.com/share/eec431673b5e41f1968e254b3255c258

Hey Nansi,

Thanks for catching that! Our designer is taking a look at the hook bin designs to fix the cut-off issue. We’ll circle back as soon as that’s done.

If there’s anything else you need in the meantime, always happy to help!

The hook bin images are cut off on the side

Please fix this.

Hey Nansi,

Adriane here from Wolf IQ Support - stepping in for Allie.

Just a quick update: we’ve adjusted the page so the items display more clearly. The bins are now shown larger, with unit measurements in bigger, easier-to-read text. You can take a look here:
🔗 Skip Bin Sizes Page

If there’s anything else you’d like tweaked, just let us know.

Always happy to help!

Hi Nansi,

Thanks so much for your feedback—and for sharing the competitor example, that’s super helpful.

We’ve passed everything along to our designer and are already looking into ways to improve how the images display. We’ll circle back with an update, once we’ve tested a few adjustments.

Let us know if there's anything else we can do for you, always happy to help
got this @allieB . contacting Zeph to have it done by the day. thanks.
